question.title: How send an object from PHP to Java web service using SOAP?

node.contents: Can you show us your WSDL? Also you might want to check the examples [here](http://www.php.net/manual/en/soapclient.soapclient.php) where the option `"classmap"` is used in the `SoapClient` constructor.

astNode.text: Can you show us your WSDL? Also you might want to check the examples [here](http://www.php.net/manual/en/soapclient.soapclient.php) where the option `"classmap"` is used in the `SoapClient` constructor.

node.contents:
I have a running web service (using EclipseLink as JPA provider) and would like to call the methods that updates data in the database from PHP using SOAP.

A method in the web service may look something like this:

astNode.text:
I have a running web service (using EclipseLink as JPA provider) and would like to call the methods that updates data in the database from PHP using SOAP.

A method in the web service may look something like this:

elements.contents: public void updatePerson(Person p){ EntityManagerFactory emf = Persistence.createEntityManagerFactory("PersonLib"); EntityManager em = emf.createEntityManager(); if(!em.getTransaction().isActive()) { em.getTransaction().begin(); } em.merge(p); em.getTransaction().commit(); }

units.rawText: public void updatePerson(Person p){ EntityManagerFactory emf = Persistence.createEntityManagerFactory("PersonLib"); EntityManager em = emf.createEntityManager(); if(!em.getTransaction().isActive()) { em.getTransaction().begin(); } em.merge(p); em.getTransaction().commit(); }

node.contents: From PHP, I guess I have to create an object of type stdClass and send it as the parameter for a Person. Am I right? But I don´t get it work with these lines of code:

astNode.text: From PHP, I guess I have to create an object of type stdClass and send it as the parameter for a Person. Am I right? But I don´t get it work with these lines of code:

elements.contents: $client = new SoapClient("url.to.wsdl", array("trace" => 1)); $obj = new stdClass(); $obj->Person = new stdClass(); $obj->Person->personId = 1; $obj->Person->name = "Peter"; $client->updatePerson($obj);

units.rawText: $client = new SoapClient("url.to.wsdl", array("trace" => 1)); $obj = new stdClass(); $obj->Person = new stdClass(); $obj->Person->personId = 1; $obj->Person->name = "Peter"; $client->updatePerson($obj);

node.contents: I don´t know if this is the correct way to send an object from PHP to Java (well, it calls the method updatePerson(Person p) in the java application, but p doesn´t contain the data I entered in PHP).

astNode.text: I don´t know if this is the correct way to send an object from PHP to Java (well, it calls the method updatePerson(Person p) in the java application, but p doesn´t contain the data I entered in PHP).

node.contents: I got it working some days ago. But I did´t no I could send an array instead of objects of type stdClass! :-) Thank you for that!

astNode.text: I got it working some days ago. But I did´t no I could send an array instead of objects of type stdClass! :-) Thank you for that!

node.contents: if it's possible please show us the WSDL file.

astNode.text: if it's possible please show us the WSDL file.

node.contents: Usually when I work with SoapClient in PHP I use arrays even if the web service expects an object, so, instead of creating a new stdClass try sending the following array:

astNode.text: Usually when I work with SoapClient in PHP I use arrays even if the web service expects an object, so, instead of creating a new stdClass try sending the following array:

node.contents: And that should send the object with the required data.

astNode.text: And that should send the object with the required data.
